info.name: Chat Configuration API
info.description:
This API supports share Chat configuration to facilitate chat integration across platforms, based on below : country, language, platform, optionally: Customer Classification, Contract (Eclipse user or not), Product Details (Category, Sub-category, Range) and Subject.
This API also allows customer facing applications to retrieve the case resolving agent associated to the case by providing a case number. This functionality is majorly consumed to know agent availability on chat.

Contact Support:
 Name: Pooja Thayil
 Email: pooja.suresh@se.com

header.description: X-IDMS-Authorization for authenticated users: Allows to get the Customer Primary Classification L1, optionally L2, optionally the secondary classifcation, and the AIL for Eclipse users
Represents the bFO Access Token to access to Backend system

query.description: (Required) Represents the source application (ex: PRM, Eclipse...)
Represents the list of primary account classifications separated by comma
Represents the context of the chat, it can be either case or product

request.description:
This API returns the configuration of the chat components according to input parameters (language, country code, application).
If either BFO token or IDMS token is passed, the API returns a response with user context.
If no token is passed (no user context for public sites), the API returns generic button info as response.

response.name: OK

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: oauth2

header.description: Represents the bFO Access Token to access to Backend system ('tech apigee User' system token to be passed to grant access for public websites)
Represents the IDMS Access Token to validate end user identity

request.description:
By providing a case number, this API allows customer facing applications to retrieve the case resolving agent associated to the case. This functionality is majorly consumed to know agent availability on chat.  

If either BFO token or IDMS token is passed, the API returns a response with user context.
If no token is passed (no user context for public sites), the API returns generic button info as response.
